firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to support user authentication and profile management for the PetConnect application. It prioritizes Authorization Independence by avoiding hierarchical `get()` calls in security rules. User profiles are stored in a dedicated collection (`users`) using their unique user ID as the document ID. This structure enables simple, path-based security rules for user profile access, ensuring only the authenticated user can read or write their own profile. This eliminates the need to denormalize any authorization data. The `users/{userId}` path structure naturally supports QAPs because list operations are inherently scoped to the user's own data. The `pets` and `posts` collections are top-level collections to allow for easy querying across all pets or posts, with an `ownerId` or `authorId` field respectively to link back to the user.
